data.title: List of Films directed by Donald Petrie

data.text:
Miss Congeniality 2000 comedy film directed by Donald Petrie

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Crime, Action

Director: Donald Petrie

An FBI agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event. more »

Miss Congeniality is a 2000 American comedy film directed by Donald Petrie, written by Marc Lawrence, Katie Ford, and Caryn Lucas, and starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, William Shatner, Ernie Hudson, and Candice Bergen.

Just My Luck 2006 film directed by Donald Petrie

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Fantasy, Romance

Director: Donald Petrie

Manhattanite Ashley is known to many as the luckiest woman around. After a chance encounter with a down-and-out young man, however, she realizes that she's ... more »

Just My Luck is a 2006 American romantic comedy drama film directed by Donald Petrie and written by I. Marlene King and Amy B. Harris. The film stars Lindsay Lohan and Chris Pine as the main characters. Lohan stars as Ashley, the luckiest girl in Manhattan, New York City. She loses her luck after kissing Jake, portrayed by Pine, at a masquerade bash.

How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days 2003 romantic comedy film

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Romance

Director: Donald Petrie

Benjamin Barry is an advertising executive and ladies' man who, to win a big campaign, bets that he can make a woman fall in love with him in 10 days. more »

How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days is a 2003 romantic comedy film directed by Donald Petrie, starring Kate Hudson and Matthew McConaughey. It is based on a short cartoon book of the same name by Michele Alexander and Jeannie Long.

Grumpy Old Men 1993 American romantic comedy film directed by Donald Petrie

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Drama, Romance

Director: Donald Petrie

A lifelong feud between two neighbors since childhood only gets worse when a new female neighbor moves across the street. more »

rank #5 · 4 9

Grumpy Old Men is a 1993 American romantic comedy film starring Jack Lemmon, Walter Matthau, and Ann-Margret, along with Burgess Meredith, Daryl Hannah, Kevin Pollak, Ossie Davis, and Buck Henry and directed by Donald Petrie. The screenplay was written by Mark Steven Johnson, who also wrote the sequel Grumpier Old Men (1995). The original music score was composed by Alan Silvestri. This was the sixth film starring both Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau, and their first pairing since 1981's Buddy Buddy.

Kathy is married to Peter. Now she can't help but wonder how things could have been if she got together with her old boyfriend... more »

rank #6 · 10

The Favor is a 1994 romantic comedy film directed by Donald Petrie and written by Sara Parriott and Josann McGibbon. It stars Harley Jane Kozak, Elizabeth McGovern, Bill Pullman, Brad Pitt and Ken Wahl. The original music score was composed by Thomas Newman.

Richie Rich 1994 American film

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Family

Director: Donald Petrie

A rich young boy finds his family the target of an inside job, and must use his cunning to save them. more »

rank #7 · 4 4

Richie Rich (stylized as Ri¢hie Ri¢h) is a 1994 American comedy film directed by Donald Petrie and based on the character of the same name created by Alfred Harvey and Warren Kremer. The film was distributed by Warner Bros. under their Warner Bros. Family Entertainment label. The film stars Macaulay Culkin (in his final film as a child actor), John Larroquette, Edward Herrmann, Jonathan Hyde, and Christine Ebersole, while Reggie Jackson, Claudia Schiffer, and Ben Stein appear in cameo roles. Culkin's younger brother, Rory Culkin, played the part of Young Richie Rich. In theaters, the film was shown with a Wile E. Coyote and the Road Runner cartoon called Chariots of Fur, and it was followed by the direct-to-video sequel Richie Rich's Christmas Wish.

1990s English-language films · 3,887T

Richie Rich (film series) · 3T

My Life in Ruins 2009 film by Donald Petrie

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Romance

Director: Donald Petrie

Writer: Mike Reiss

A disgruntled tour guide in Greece gains an unexpected new outlook on life thanks to one of the people on what she intends to be her last tour. more »

My Life in Ruins (UK title: Driving Aphrodite) is a 2009 romantic comedy film set amongst the ruins of ancient Greece, starring Nia Vardalos, Richard Dreyfuss, Alexis Georgoulis, Rachel Dratch, Harland Williams and Alistair McGowan. The film is about a tour guide whose life takes a personal detour, while her group gets entangled in comic situations among the ruins, with a series of unexpected stops along the way. The film was released on June 5, 2009 in the United States, and May 7, 2009 in Greece.

My Favorite Martian 1999 comic science fiction film directed by Donald Petrie

0 0

Genre: Family, Comedy, Sci-Fi

Director: Donald Petrie

A Martian lands on Earth and makes friends with a reporter. more »

rank #9 · 10 4

My Favorite Martian is a 1999 American live-action science-fiction comedy film starring Christopher Lloyd, Jeff Daniels, Daryl Hannah, Elizabeth Hurley, Wallace Shawn and Ray Walston, based on the 1960s television series of the same name in which Walston starred. A Mickey Mouse Works short, "Pluto Gets The Paper: Spaceship," was shown in theaters with it.
